This can be a useful technique.

As a side note, before using any hackery i=
n tests, (and I'm a
shameless hackerer), I often find it worth listening to=
 what the tests
are telling me.  For example, you had a read-only interface=
 for a
library of Books that was just fine for the current implementation o=
f
the BookService class.  Perhaps keeping a read-only interface would
make =
it clearer which clients needed to change the book collection,
and which ju=
st needed to read it.

  David Saff
